title-group.article-title: Road Test Results of an I-C Engine Misfire Detection System

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1994 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: This paper presents results of experimental results of a misfire detection system for cars equipped with gasoline fueled engines and both manual and automatic transmissions. A brief overview of the theory of the method and discussion of instrumentation is also given. The performance of the method for cars operated on a chassis dynamometer and on various roads is presented.

ref.mixed-citation: W. B. Ribbens and D. Gross, "Torque Nonuniformity Measurements in Gasoline Fueled Passenger Cars Equipped with Automatic Transmissions - Theory and Experimental Results," SAE International Congress and Expositions, Detroit, Michigan, February 24-28, 1986, SAE 860414.
W. B. Ribbens, "Experimental Road Test of a Noncontacting Method of Measuring IC Engine Torque Nonuniformity," SAE International Congress and Expositions, Detroit, Michigan, 1985, SAE 850454.
W. B. Ribbens, "A Noncontacting Torque Sensor for the Internal Combustion Engine," SAE International Congress and Expositions, Detroit, Michigan, 1981, SAE 810155.

W. B. Ribbens, Y. Dong and G. Rizzoni, "Fault Tolerant Crankshaft Position Measurements with Applications to Ignition Timing, Diagnostics and Performance Measurements," SAE Passenger Car Expositions, Dearborn, Michigan, 1987, SAE 871914.

W. B. Ribbens and G. Rizzoni, "Applications of Precise Crankshaft Position Measurement for Engine Testing Control and Diagnosis," SAE International Congress and Expositions, Detroit, Michigan, 1989, SAE 890885.
